DOC.brief_summary: The current project was designed to examine dynamic changes in muscle wasting during sepsis. Researchers will focus the mitochondrial dysfunction of muscle cells and investigate the role of HO-1 in it. Researchers interested in identifying factors involved in the pathology of muscle wasting during sepsis.
DOC.brief_title: HO-1 and Muscle Mitochondrial Dysfunction in Sepsis
DOC.detailed_description: Rapid muscle atrophy or muscle wasting occured to septic patients.Sepsis induced muscle wasting has become a severe, frequent, and persistent complication among critically ill patients. Multiple factors including ubiquitin-proteasome system, proinflammatory cytokines and oxidative stress contribute muscle proteolysis. It is known that heme oxygenase-1 (HO-1) possesses a variety of functions like anti-inflammatory, antioxidative and anti-apoptosis effects. In order to investigate the mechanisms under the condition, researchers are going to examine the role of HO-1 in muscle atrophy during sepsis.
